channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.description: Looks like Tracy's got a bit to learn about Facebook's privacy settings...

item.description: Words can't explain the pure awesome that is encased in this clip.

item.title: [+1157] Feeling Hot.. Hot.. Hot..
[+810] This Star Wars wedding is perfectly normal, not weird at all
[+782] GOPers: If Obama's HC Reform Passes, States Should Rebel!
item.description: Sen. Jim DeMint (R-SC) and Rep. Michele Bachmann (R-MN) said that if a health care bill passes, it should be actively fought and resisted through a collective effort of conservative governors.

item.title: [+770] Unpublished Marijuana Book Makes Amazon.com Bestseller List
item.description: Yesterday, "Marijuana is Safer" hit number 14 on Amazon's bestselling book list, beating out heavyweights like Malcolm Gladwell's "Outliers" and the newest installment of the "Twilight" saga -- even though Mason Tvert's straight-to-paperback tome won't actually be released until September 15.

item.title: [+748] Star Wars Old Republic PC Walkthrough First-Look (vid)
item.description: FOR PART 2,3, & 4 CLICK ON SIDEBAR WIDGET!

item.title: [+646] YOU should fix that bug
item.description: Yesterday, I spearheaded a new movement at the office. I stopped using the word "we", and started to say what I really meant to say. For example, instead of "We should fix that bug", I say, "You should fix that bug", and good God is it satisfying.

item.title: [+611] HBG Multiplayer Marathon for Standupforkids.org
item.description: 48 hours of non stop multiplayer gaming to raise money for Standupforkids.org

item.title: [+599] Good morning kitty cat [Animated gif]
[+599] Kids In The Hall Return For 8 Part TV Series
item.description: Fifteen years after The Kids in the Hall aired on CBC Television, the five original members of the Canadian sketch comedy team have reassembled in North Bay, Ont., to shoot an eight-part TV series.

item.title: [+595] Idaho GOP leader pulls .357 Magnum on delinquent homeowner
item.description: According to police in the Boise suburb of Meridian, resident Robert Lutes called officers just before 5:30 p.m. Tuesday to report McAffee had pointed a .357 Magnum handgun at him during a verbal confrontation. McAffee acknowledged he pointed the gun at Lutes, according to the police account. (His employer? A Wells Fargo contractor).

item.title: [+558] Magician Helps Create a Magical Marriage Proposal
[+557] Flickr v. Free Speech. Where Is The Courage?
item.description: Flickr really stepped in it this time. And they’ve sparked a free speech and copyright fascism debate that is unlikely to cool down any time soon.

item.title: [+532] Stunning Aurora Over Antarctica (PIC)
item.description: This is a stunning shot of a Scott tent at the Geographic South Pole, Antarctica. Set up outside the Amundsen-Scott South Pole Station, a 30 second exposure captures an aurora over the tent. Campers stay here overnight in order to get out of the station and sleep at -80F°. Click to enlarge. (Photo: Patrick Cullis)

item.title: [+518] digg.git - part 1
item.description: An article outlining the digg.com engineering teams switch from svn to git. Basically sings git's praises, without getting technical.

item.title: [+512] The 12 most annoying types of Facebookers
item.description: Facebook, for better or worse, is like being at a big party with all your friends, family, acquaintances and co-workers.
